natural problem: How many miles can a car travel in 20 minutes if it travels $ \, \frac{3}{4} \, $ as fast as a train going 80 miles per hour?
natural solution: The car travels at a speed of $$\frac{3}{4}\times80\text{ miles per hour}=3\times20=60\text{ miles per hour}.$$ In $20$ minutes, the car travels $$\frac{60 \text{ miles}}{60\text{ minutes}}\times20\text{ minutes}=1\times20=\boxed{20\text{ miles}}.$$

a_0.formal problem:
theorem
fixes car_speed train_speed :: real
assumes h0 : "car_speed = 3 / 4 * train_speed"
and h1 : "train_speed = 80"
and h2 : "20 = car_speed * (1/3)"
shows  "car_speed * (1/3) = 20"
a_0.formal solution:
(* ### Problem
 How many miles can a car travel in 20 minutes if it travels $ \, \frac{3}{4} \, $ as fast as a train going 80 miles per hour? The final Answer is 20\text{ miles}
 ### Proof
 The car travels at a speed of $$\frac{3}{4}\times80\text{ miles per hour}=3\times20=60\text{ miles per hour}.$$ In $20$ minutes, the car travels $$\frac{60 \text{ miles}}{60\text{ minutes}}\times20\text{ minutes}=1\times20=\boxed{20\text{ miles}}.$$
 *)

theorem
fixes car_speed train_speed :: real
assumes h0 : "car_speed = 3 / 4 * train_speed"
and h1 : "train_speed = 80"
and h2 : "20 = car_speed * (1/3)"
shows  "car_speed * (1/3) = 20"
 proof- 
  show ?thesis sledgehammer
a_0.informal problem: A car is traveling at 3/4 the speed of a train. If the train is traveling at 80 miles per hour, and the car travels for 1/3 of an hour, how far does the car travel? The final answer is 20 miles.

a_1.formal problem:
theorem
fixes car_speed train_speed :: real
and time :: real
assumes h0 : "train_speed = 80"
and h1 : "car_speed = 3 / 4 * train_speed"
and h2 : "time = 20 / 60"
shows  "car_speed * time = 20" (* distance = speed * time *)
a_1.formal solution:
(* ### Problem
 How many miles can a car travel in 20 minutes if it travels $ \, \frac{3}{4} \, $ as fast as a train going 80 miles per hour? The final Answer is 20\text{ miles}
 ### Proof
 The car travels at a speed of $$\frac{3}{4}\times80\text{ miles per hour}=3\times20=60\text{ miles per hour}.$$ In $20$ minutes, the car travels $$\frac{60 \text{ miles}}{60\text{ minutes}}\times20\text{ minutes}=1\times20=\boxed{20\text{ miles}}.$$
 *)

theorem
fixes car_speed train_speed :: real
and time :: real
assumes h0 : "train_speed = 80"
and h1 : "car_speed = 3 / 4 * train_speed"
and h2 : "time = 20 / 60"
shows  "car_speed * time = 20" (* distance = speed * time *)
 proof- 
  show ?thesis sledgehammer
a_1.informal problem: A train is moving at a speed of 80 km/h. A car is moving at 3/4 the speed of the train. How far will the car travel in 20 minutes? The final answer is 20 km.

a_2.formal problem:
theorem
fixes speed_train speed_car :: real
and miles_car :: real
and time :: real
assumes h0 : "speed_train = 80"
and h1 : "speed_car = 3 / 4 * speed_train"
and h2 : "time = 20 / 60"
and h3 : "miles_car = speed_car * time"
shows  "miles_car = 20"
a_2.formal solution:
(* ### Problem
 How many miles can a car travel in 20 minutes if it travels $ \, \frac{3}{4} \, $ as fast as a train going 80 miles per hour? The final Answer is 20\text{ miles}
 ### Proof
 The car travels at a speed of $$\frac{3}{4}\times80\text{ miles per hour}=3\times20=60\text{ miles per hour}.$$ In $20$ minutes, the car travels $$\frac{60 \text{ miles}}{60\text{ minutes}}\times20\text{ minutes}=1\times20=\boxed{20\text{ miles}}.$$
 *)

theorem
fixes speed_train speed_car :: real
and miles_car :: real
and time :: real
assumes h0 : "speed_train = 80"
and h1 : "speed_car = 3 / 4 * speed_train"
and h2 : "time = 20 / 60"
and h3 : "miles_car = speed_car * time"
shows  "miles_car = 20"
 proof- 
  show ?thesis sledgehammer
a_2.informal problem: A train travels at a speed of 80 miles per hour. A car travels at 3/4 of the speed of the train. If the car travels for 20 minutes, how many miles does the car travel? The final answer is 20 miles.

a_3.formal problem:
theorem
fixes car_speed train_speed :: real
and time :: real
assumes h0 : "car_speed = 3 / 4 * train_speed"
and h1 : "train_speed = 80"
and h2 : "time = 20 / 60"
shows  "car_speed * time = 20"
a_3.formal solution:

 ### Proof
 The car travels at a speed of $$\frac{3}{4}\times80\text{ miles per hour}=3\times20=60\text{ miles per hour}.$$ In $20$ minutes, the car travels $$\frac{60 \text{ miles}}{60\text{ minutes}}\times20\text{ minutes}=1\times20=\boxed{20\text{ miles}}.$$
 *)

theorem
fixes car_speed train_speed :: real
and time :: real
assumes h0 : "car_speed = 3 / 4 * train_speed"
and h1 : "train_speed = 80"
and h2 : "time = 20 / 60"
shows  "car_speed * time = 20"
 proof- 
  show ?thesis sledgehammer
a_3.informal problem: A car travels at a speed which is three-fourths the speed of a train. If the train is moving at 80 miles per hour and the car has been driving for 20 minutes, how far has the car traveled? The final answer is 20 miles.

a_4.formal problem:
theorem
fixes car_speed train_speed :: real
assumes h0 : "train_speed = 80"
and h1 : "car_speed = (3 / 4) * train_speed"
and h2 : "1 * hour = 60 * minute"
shows  "20 * minute * car_speed = 20 * mile"
a_4.formal solution:
(* ### Problem
 How many miles can a car travel in 20 minutes if it travels $ \, \frac{3}{4} \, $ as fast as a train going 80 miles per hour? The final Answer is 20\text{ miles}
 ### Proof
 The car travels at a speed of $$\frac{3}{4}\times80\text{ miles per hour}=3\times20=60\text{ miles per hour}.$$ In $20$ minutes, the car travels $$\frac{60 \text{ miles}}{60\text{ minutes}}\times20\text{ minutes}=1\times20=\boxed{20\text{ miles}}.$$
 *)

theorem
fixes car_speed train_speed :: real
assumes h0 : "train_speed = 80"
and h1 : "car_speed = (3 / 4) * train_speed"
and h2 : "1 * hour = 60 * minute"
shows  "20 * minute * car_speed = 20 * mile"
 proof- 
  show ?thesis sledgehammer
a_4.informal problem: A train is traveling at 80 miles per hour. A car is traveling at 3/4 the speed of the train. How far does the car travel in 20 minutes? The final answer is 20 miles.

a_5.formal problem:
theorem
fixes car_speed train_speed distance :: real
assumes h0 : "train_speed = 80"
and h1 : "car_speed = train_speed * (3 / 4)"
and h2 : "20 * car_speed = 60 * distance"
shows  "distance = 20"
a_5.formal solution:
(* ### Problem
 How many miles can a car travel in 20 minutes if it travels $ \, \frac{3}{4} \, $ as fast as a train going 80 miles per hour? The final Answer is 20\text{ miles}
 ### Proof
 The car travels at a speed of $$\frac{3}{4}\times80\text{ miles per hour}=3\times20=60\text{ miles per hour}.$$ In $20$ minutes, the car travels $$\frac{60 \text{ miles}}{60\text{ minutes}}\times20\text{ minutes}=1\times20=\boxed{20\text{ miles}}.$$
 *)

theorem
fixes car_speed train_speed distance :: real
assumes h0 : "train_speed = 80"
and h1 : "car_speed = train_speed * (3 / 4)"
and h2 : "20 * car_speed = 60 * distance"
shows  "distance = 20"
 proof- 
  show ?thesis sledgehammer
a_5.informal problem: A car is traveling at a speed that is three-quarters the speed of a train. The train is traveling at 80 mph. If the car covers the same distance in 20 hours that the train covers in 60 hours, find the distance covered. The final answer is 20 miles.

a_6.formal problem:
theorem
fixes car_speed train_speed :: real
assumes h0 : "car_speed = (3/4) * train_speed"
and h1 : "train_speed = 80"
and h2 : "20 * minutes = 1/3 * hours"
shows  "car_speed * (1/3) * hours = 20"
a_6.formal solution:
(* ### Problem
 How many miles can a car travel in 20 minutes if it travels $ \, \frac{3}{4} \, $ as fast as a train going 80 miles per hour? The final Answer is 20\text{ miles}
 ### Proof
 The car travels at a speed of $$\frac{3}{4}\times80\text{ miles per hour}=3\times20=60\text{ miles per hour}.$$ In $20$ minutes, the car travels $$\frac{60 \text{ miles}}{60\text{ minutes}}\times20\text{ minutes}=1\times20=\boxed{20\text{ miles}}.$$
 *)

theorem
fixes car_speed train_speed :: real
assumes h0 : "car_speed = (3/4) * train_speed"
and h1 : "train_speed = 80"
and h2 : "20 * minutes = 1/3 * hours"
shows  "car_speed * (1/3) * hours = 20"
 proof- 
  show ?thesis sledgehammer
a_6.informal problem: A train is traveling at a speed of 80 miles per hour. A car is traveling at a speed of 3/4 that of the train. If the car travels for 1/3 of an hour, how many miles does it cover? The final answer is 20 miles.

a_7.formal problem:
theorem
fixes car_speed train_speed :: real
and minutes :: real
assumes h0 : "train_speed = 80"
and h1 : "car_speed = 3 / 4 * train_speed"
and h2 : "minutes = 20"
shows  "car_speed * (minutes / 60) = 20" (* Distance traveled by car in miles *)
a_7.formal solution:
(* ### Problem
 How many miles can a car travel in 20 minutes if it travels $ \, \frac{3}{4} \, $ as fast as a train going 80 miles per hour? The final Answer is 20\text{ miles}
 ### Proof
 The car travels at a speed of $$\frac{3}{4}\times80\text{ miles per hour}=3\times20=60\text{ miles per hour}.$$ In $20$ minutes, the car travels $$\frac{60 \text{ miles}}{60\text{ minutes}}\times20\text{ minutes}=1\times20=\boxed{20\text{ miles}}.$$
 *)

theorem
fixes car_speed train_speed :: real
and minutes :: real
assumes h0 : "train_speed = 80"
and h1 : "car_speed = 3 / 4 * train_speed"
and h2 : "minutes = 20"
shows  "car_speed * (minutes / 60) = 20" (* Distance traveled by car in miles *)
 proof- 
  show ?thesis sledgehammer
a_7.informal problem: A train is traveling at a speed of 80 miles per hour. A car is traveling at 3/4 the speed of the train. How far does the car travel in 20 minutes? The final answer is 20 miles.

a_8.formal problem:
theorem
fixes car_speed train_speed :: real
assumes h0 : "train_speed = 80"
and h1 : "car_speed = (3 / 4) * train_speed"
and h2 : "20 * car_speed = 60 * distance"
shows  "distance = 20"
a_8.formal solution:
(* ### Problem
 How many miles can a car travel in 20 minutes if it travels $ \, \frac{3}{4} \, $ as fast as a train going 80 miles per hour? The final Answer is 20\text{ miles}

 *)

theorem
fixes car_speed train_speed :: real
assumes h0 : "train_speed = 80"
and h1 : "car_speed = (3 / 4) * train_speed"
and h2 : "20 * car_speed = 60 * distance"
shows  "distance = 20"
 proof- 
  show ?thesis sledgehammer
a_8.informal problem: A train is traveling at a speed of 80 km/h. A car is traveling at $\frac{3}{4}$ of the train's speed. If the car travels for 20 hours to cover the same distance that the train covers in 60 hours, what is the total distance traveled? The final answer is 20 kilometers.
